message: If you've problems connecting to secure websites currently, check this & help solve the problem..
story: Abdelrahman Omran shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Let’s Solve Egyptian ISP DST change issues — Abdelrahman Omran’s Blog
caption: blog.omranic.com
description: I’m working in web development industry, and thus I’m trying here to diagnose how this Daylight Saving Time change still affects me and…

data.message: How did you conclude it's DST related ?

Well, in my personal experience, the issues started after DST expected time change with a week or so. I was able to confirm that they were related to pre-set set of IP addresses(adding a new IP to the same server "solves" the problem). And using a network sniffer I was able see that the packets dropped are the ones related to TLS negotiation, meaning it's not a routing issue, but more likely a DPI situation. 

I am only asking because this is the first initiative I saw to actually talk to/expose ISPs. So, wanted to make sure all the information is available.. 

There were several posts about this with a great deal of information in the the past few weeks, you might be interested in looking them up.

Well, some people claims it's a Deep packet inspection issue which could be true, but I can't get it why there's other similar websites, same region, same datacenter, same SSL certificates, but on different servers and it's working fine. So I'm not sure of the reason, and I haven't supplied a solution, it's just a simple way of diagnosis for normal users, and an encouragement to stress on ISPs to solve the problem whatever it's cause is.

Mohamed El-Sayed By the way, if it's a DPI issue, is it related to the ISPs anyway? If not, is there any explanation why it's been solved for a period of time (almost a month), and then appeared again? I'm just asking to understand and know who we could talk to, or the way we look at for solutions..
I was able to replicate the issue with multiple providers, so probably not on the ISP level. And I still have the same issues till now, it didn't go away :D

I personally believe Egyptian ISPs could solve it since these issues appeared, and solved before (for multiple websites I own, and others I don't own), unless we’re facing here a situation where the government is playing with the DPI filters and can’t configure/use it!! :D
